title: Basic String Operations
description: In this lab, you will learn about the basic string operations in shell scripting. String operations are useful when manipulating and extracting data from strings. You will learn about string length, index, substring extraction, substring replacement, and more.

meta.title: Mastering Basic String Operations in Shell Scripting
meta.description: Explore the fundamental techniques for manipulating strings in shell scripts, including length, indexing, and substring extraction.
meta.keywords: linux lab, shell scripting, linux practice exercises, online kali linux terminal, practice linux commands online, string operations, string indexing, string length, substring extraction, linux practice online

verify.name: Verify the existence of string_operations.sh
verify.hint: Make sure you've created the file 'string_operations.sh' in the ~/project directory.

verify.name: Verify the shebang line
verify.hint: Ensure that the first line of your script is '#!/bin/bash'.

verify.name: Verify string length calculation
verify.hint: Make sure you've added the line 'LENGTH=${#STRING}' to calculate the string length.

verify.name: Verify character position finding
verify.hint: Ensure you've added the line 'POSITION=$(expr index "$STRING" "$CHAR")' to find the character position.

verify.name: Verify substring extraction
verify.hint: Make sure you've added the line 'SUBSTRING=${STRING:$START:$LENGTH}' to extract the substring.

verify.name: Verify string replacement operations
verify.hint: Ensure you've added the line 'NEW_STRING=${STRING/o/O}' to perform the first string replacement operation.
